titles.title: Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” (the first half of the year)

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Sǝnkǝssar “Synaxarion” for the first half of the year (fols. 2ra-232vc) I-1) Mäskäräm (fols. 2ra-42rc) I-2) Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 43ra-77vc) I-3) Ḫǝdar (fols. 78ra-113vc) I-4) Taḫśaś (fols. 114ra-158vc) I-5) Ṭǝrr (fols. 159ra-201rc) I-6) Yäkkatit (fols. 202ra-232vc), incomplete
The commemorative notices are followed by ʿarke-hymns.

donors.donor: The names of the original donors have mostly been erased or crossed out in the supplication formulas but are still legible on several fols.: Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾ (e.g., fols. 2rb, 3va, 5vc, 6va, 8rab, 9rbc), Wäldä Rufaʾel (e.g., fols. 18rc, 38rc, 41vb), Wälättä ʾArägawi (e.g., fols. 34va, 38rb, 41va), Täsfa Giyorgis (e.g., fols. 40ra, 49vc, 75vc). Their names have been replaced in a secondary hand by the names of Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb (e.g., fols. 11ra, 12vb, 13rbc, 14ra), Wälättä Mäsqäl (e.g., fols. 25vc, 27rac, 30ra, 30vbc), Wälättä Maryam (e.g., fols. 16vb, 17ra, 18rc, 27va).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is incomplete, the end is missing. The front and back boards are missing. The sewing has been repaired; some fols., especially in quire I, are held in place by crude recent stitches. The Ms. is severely worn at the margin, esp. at the beginning and the end, sometimes with the loss of text (e.g., fols. 232rb). Most fols. are affected by humidity; several fols are stained with wax or dirt. The text has been partly damaged on fols. 188v, 221r. Fol. 7 is misplaced: it originally followed fol. 227. Some fols. are missing. Fol. 42 is half the size of the other fols. Holes or tears amended, e.g., on fols. 3, 17, 26, 38, 72, 97, 109.

squires.squire:
I(8+1/fols. 1r-10v) – ፪II(12/fols. 11r-22v) – ፫III(8/fols. 23r-30v) – ፬IV(10/fols. 31r-40v) – ፭V(12/fols. 41r-52v) – ፮VI(12/fols. 53r-64v) – ፯VII(12/fols. 65r-76v) – ፰VIII(12/fols. 77r-88v) – ፱IX(12/fols. 89r-100v) – ፲X(13; s.l.: 10, stub after 3/fols. 101r-113v) – XI(10/114r-123v) – XII(10/fols. 124r-133v) – ፫XIII(10/fols. 134r-143v) – ፬XIV(10/fols. 144r-153v) – ፭XV(10/fols. 154r-163v) – ፮XVI(10/fols. 164r-173v) – ፯XVII(10/fols. 174r-183v) – ፰XVIII(10/fols. 184r-193v) – XIX(8/fols. 194r-201v) – XX(12/fols. 202r-213v) – XXI(8/fols. 214r-221v) – XXII(8-2/fols. 222r-227v) – XXIII(8-3/fols. 228r-232v).
The quire numbers start again at ፩ on quire XI. Fol. 7 originally belonged to quire XXII, after fol. 227. The last leaf of quire XXII and the last three leaves of quire XXIII are missing.

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; a few lines of the incipit pages of Texts I-1 to I-6, alternating with black lines; incipit of each commemorative notice; the word sälam; elements of the punctuation signs, the text dividers and the quire marks; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

extras.extra: - Erasures: e.g. fols. 31ra, 31vb, 33rb, 33va, 38vb, 42vb. - Erasures marked by thin lines: e.g., fols. 14rb, 17rb, 18vab, 25vb, 28vb, 56vc. - Corrections written over erasures: e.g., fols. 13vc, 15va, 19vc, 20rbc, 30vc, 97vbc. - Immediate corrections marked by thin lines above and below the words: e.g., 21rab, 21va, 22ra, 22vb, 25rc. - Omitted letters, words or passages added interlineally or in the margin: e.g., fols. 8ra, 12rabc, 13rab, 14vc, 15vb, 17rabc. - Tämälläs sign indicating the place where the omission written in the margin belongs: e.g., fols. 11vab, 13vac, 14va, 16vc, 32rac, 34vc. - Scribbles and doodles: fols. 57v, 117r, 201v, 204v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Decorated quire marks written in the upper margin on fols. 11r, 23r, 31r, 41r, 53r, 65r, 77r, 89r, 101r. - Undecorated quire marks written in the upper right corner on fols. 134r, 144r, 154r, 164r, 174r, 184r.

frames.frame: Fol. 2r (incipit page of Text I-1): uncoloured ornamental band; anthropomorphic motifs (faces). Fol. 113vc: simple short coloured (red, black, white) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
